name: places/ChIJHy1hC0tZwokRjwwpxn4vuGU
adrFormatAddress: 2460 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA

originalText.text: Great location! I come here a few times during the week. The staff are friendly and extremely knowledgeable. Their juices seem to be better than any location I‚Äôve been to so far!

text.text: Great location! I come here a few times during the week. The staff are friendly and extremely knowledgeable. Their juices seem to be better than any location I‚Äôve been to so far!

originalText.text: I came here three times within the past week and will likely not be coming back or at least not often despite the convenient location. It wasn‚Äôt crowded yet I had to wait so long to get a joes club and a muffin. I wasn‚Äôt disappointed the first time despite the wait. Second time, I just came in for a ready to go muffin, that for whatever reason, took the cashier between five to ten minutes to hand over to me. They apologized and that was that. Third time, I waited for about twenty minutes for a joes club and a muffin. No apologies this time. She could have at least gave me the muffin so I had something to eat while I waiting for the sandwich. The joes club wasn‚Äôt as tasty compared to the first time I had it.

originalText.text: Lady at the register had a bad attitude, didn‚Äôt take my order correctly, didn‚Äôt had cash for change, the avocado was way too ripe and the worst I found HAIR on my sandwich üò° I know it‚Äôs hers bc it‚Äôs a black hair, worst experience ever!!!

originalText.text: I just went into this location to get a hot coffee and a tunacado sandwich and just to warm up because it was quite cold today in nyc (45f). When I went in there to order the door was propped open widely and after ordering and trying to choose a place to sit, the long bench by the window across the ordering corner was occupied by this guy who was practically laying down all the way horizontally. And since I didn‚Äôt have want to sit at the bar style high tops, I had to go to the tables by the door, but it was very cold with the door open. I asked the girl behind the counter if I could close the door she said ‚Äúno, because it gets very hot back here‚Äù and I said I will be here for only about 15 minutes just to finish my coffee and sandwich, can we just close it until I‚Äôm gone, she goes ‚Äúno it gets hot in here‚Äù. And I had no other choice but to eat in the cold. And I found out the guy who was laying down on the bench inside was either the friend or the boyfriend of the girl who is behind the counter. What kind of service is that? Why a paying customer has to sit in the cold and drink/eat their food and drink? I went in there with a sole purpose of warming up with a hot cup of coffee, but I instead wasted my $20 and ate in the cold. Do better! Train your staff with professionalism and respect for customers, and do something about their friends just laying down in the shop where paying customers could sit down‚Äù

What kind of service is that? Why a paying customer has to sit in the cold and drink/eat their food and drink? Train your staff with professionalism and respect for customers, and do something about their friends just laying down in the shop where paying customers could sit down‚Äù

originalText.text: I ordered the herb tonic for pickup. The herb tonic signature juice contained turmeric, ginger, pineapple, red bell pepper, black pepper and apple. My order was ready in about 15 minutes from the time that I put in the order. When I picked it up, my drink was prepackaged in a pink paper bag at the front counter. This seemed like a nice place to get some work done, since it was very empty at 6:00 p.m. There was also outdoor seating available. There was some bar style seating, and some chairs and tables. The chairs were made out of cloth and seemed a little bit dirty. The juice itself was pretty good, the pineapple and apple really helped sweetened up ingredients that are not naturally sweet. I really like the black pepper and the kick that came through with it.
